intro: Centaurea sagredoi subsp. pulvinata, commonly known as the Sierra Madre centaury, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves, and it produces small, spiky seed heads. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
